content.description: Stand start on 2 holds down low (right side pull, left hand on an ok pointy hold) Climb straight up arete using good holds. Don’t use the right side of the rock down low, but once you get about 2/3rd of the way up , you can’t help but lean into it . crux is in the middle (the only hold that isn’t super juggy) easy topout too / walkoff around back
content.location: Walking from the main climbing area to king of cowards , this boulder (which has a few decent problems around it ) is at the top of a hill on the right side (after the highball) , but before you get to king of cowards.

content.description: Fun fact: Griff in Welsh means “strong grip”Sit start down low on two pointy jugs, and work your way up and right. All of the holds used are jugs , until the top out. (Walk off to the left after you top out)Definitely my favorite boulder to climb in this area. Wish it were longer , but the move set on this problem is pretty fun!
content.location: located on the main trail , across the creek/ by the main climbing area . If you are directly facing the sport climbing wall , it is roughly at the 8 o clock position .

content.description: Sit start down low and work your way up and right via jugs. The 1st few moves are bouldery before you establish on the very mellow slab. This is a good beginner highball , because while you wouldn’t want to fall after you get to the slab, it’s very easy climbing. Test your mental and physical abilities on this aesthetic looking rock.  (Also there is a mellow pathway for you to down climb to get down)
content.location: If you are walking from the main climbing wall to the 5.7+ slab you’ll see this formation on your right side (kindof uphill a little bit) you shouldn’t have to look very hard to find this rock

content.description: Sit start with both hands real low on the juggy horn . Move straight up to the crimp rail to bump this problem up a grade or two, or move right to an angular hold (requires a heel hook on the start hold) and then left to the crimp. Work around the corner to some nice pinches (after you turn the corner the left wall is off) and use the right wall for your feet . go straight up for an easy finish
content.location: Located directly right of king of the hill. going from king of cowards to the main wall it’s on the left side on top of a small hill , going from main wall to king of cowards it’s on the right side on top of a small hill. There’s an old worn down trail that leads up there (some fallen trees down low)
